oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHALLOW WATER WAVES A COMPARISON OF THEORIES AND EXPERIMENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Le Mahaute, Bernard
Divoky, David
Lin, Albert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: shallow waves
theory/experiment comparison
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A series of experiments were performed to determine the velocity field and other characteristics of large amplitude shallow water waves. The experimental results were compared with the predictions of a variety of wave theories including those commonly used in engineering practice. While no theory was found exceptionally accurate, the cnoidal wave theory of Keulegan and Patterson appears most adequate for the range of wavelengths and water depths studied.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 11 (1968): Proceedings of 11th Conference on Coastal Engineering, London, United Kingdom, 1968.; 7
